alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Laramie County; East Platte County; Goshen County; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 30 at 7:54PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Goshen, northeastern Laramie and southeastern Platte Counties through 845 PM MDT... At 753 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Chugwater to 8 miles west of Meriden Rest Area to near Burns. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... La Grange, Chugwater, Albin, Yoder, Huntley, Hawk Springs Campground, Slater, Hawk Springs Recreation Area, Meriden Rest Area, Veteran, Gun Barrel and Hawk Springs. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 39 and 63. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Laramie County; East Platte County; Goshen County; South Laramie Range Foothills
